greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of 2n into distinct parts whose bitwise XOR equals 0.
comment: There are no partitions of 2n+1 into distinct parts whose bitwise XOR equals 0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..750
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(i*(i+2)/2<n, 0,
xref: Bisection (even part) of column k=0 of A307505.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 11 2019
